TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit FileNotFoundException extends System.IO.IOException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when an attempt to access a file that does not exist on disk fails.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `FileNotFoundException` uses the HRESULT COR_E_FILENOTFOUND which has the value 0x80070002.
If your code does not have <xref:System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermissionAttribute.PathDiscovery%2A> permission, the error message for this exception may only contain file or directory names instead of fully qualified paths.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with its message string set to a system-supplied message and its HRESULT set to COR_E_FILENOTFOUND.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Could not find the specified file." This message takes into account the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: A description of the error. The content of `message` is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with its message string set to and its HRESULT set to COR_E_FILENOTFOUND.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.Message%2A> property of the new instance using `message`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
An object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified serialization and context information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: A description of the error. The content of `message` is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the `innerException` parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
For more information on inner exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, string fileName) cil managed

Docs.param: A description of the error. The content of `message` is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The full name of the file with the invalid image.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with its message string set to , specifying the file name that cannot be found, and its HRESULT set to COR_E_FILENOTFOUND.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The constructor initializes the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.Message%2A> property of the new instance using `message` and the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.FileName%2A> property using `fileName`.

MemberSignature.Value: public FileNotFoundException (string message, string fileName, Exception innerException);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, string fileName, class System.Exception innerException) cil managed

Docs.param: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The full name of the file with the invalid image.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the `innerException` parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
For more information on inner exceptions, see <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the file that cannot be found.
Docs.value: The name of the file, or if no file name was passed to the constructor for this instance.

Docs.summary: Gets the log file that describes why loading of an assembly failed.
Docs.value: The errors reported by the assembly cache.
Docs.exception: The caller does not have the required permission.
Docs.permission: to provide evidence and view and modify policy. Associated enumerations: , .

MemberSignature.Value: public override void GetObjectData (System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetObjectData(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The object that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
Docs.summary: Sets the object with the file name and additional exception information.
Docs.permission: for providing serialization services. Associated enumeration: Security action:
requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Gets the error message that explains the reason for the exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If no message was supplied to the constructor for the current exception, this property returns a system-supplied error message. If the <xref:System.IO.FileLoadException.FileName%2A> property is not `null`, the message includes the file name.
This property is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the fully qualified name of this exception and possibly the error message, the name of the inner exception, and the stack trace.
Docs.returns: The fully qualified name of this exception and possibly the error message, the name of the inner exception, and the stack trace.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method overrides <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A>.
The string representation returned by this method includes the name of the exception, the value of the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.Message%2A> property, the result of calling ToString on the inner exception, the value of the <xref:System.IO.FileNotFoundException.FileName%2A> property, and the result of calling <xref:System.Environment.StackTrace%2A>. If any of these members is a null reference, its value is not included in the returned string.
